title: Add gate modification flags to issue update command
description:
Add --add-gate and --remove-gate flags to 'jit issue update' command, matching the existing pattern for labels (--label/--remove-label).

## Problem

Current: Must use separate 'jit gate add/remove' commands to modify gates on existing issues.
Desired: Modify gates directly via 'jit issue update' for API consistency and efficiency.

## Solution

Add two new flags to 'jit issue update':
- `--add-gate <KEY>` - Add gate(s) to issue (comma-separated or multiple flags)
- `--remove-gate <KEY>` - Remove gate(s) from issue

Works in both single-issue and batch mode (with --filter).

## Examples

```bash
# Single issue
jit issue update abc123 --add-gate tests --add-gate clippy

# Batch mode
jit issue update --filter "label:epic:auth" --add-gate code-review

# Combined with other updates
jit issue update abc123 --state ready --add-gate tests
```

## Acceptance Criteria

- Flags work in single-issue and batch modes
- Multiple gates supported (comma-separated and multiple flags)
- Invalid gate keys return clear errors
- Idempotent (adding duplicate is no-op)
- JSON output includes updated gates_required
- Events logged for additions/removals
- MCP schema updated
- 14+ new tests passing

See linked implementation plan for detailed design and phases.
